docs.text:
APEG


APEG is a web application that allows students completing group work to evaluate each other's contribution to the group.


Adaptable


APEG is template driven and built on open-source software 
libraries
, templates can easily be modified to provide custom content.


Peer Evaluation


Peer evaluation is the assessment or review of work by one or more people of similar competence to the producers of the work (
peers
) (
Wikipedia definition
).  


for Groups


Groups of students are able to assess each others contribution to a team using APEG.


APEG can incorporate a Blackboard
 
rubric
 or allow students to supply a numeric 'grade' with comments. The application is optimised for use with the 
Blackboard Learn
 VLE
.


The application can be adapted to to any VLE that implements the IMS Global
 Learning Tools Interoperability
 (LTI) standard.  


Students


Assessing your group's members using the peer review platform


Instructors


How to add the LTI link to your Blackboard Course and configure the tool.


Templates


Setting up the ExpressionEngine templates.


Installation


Server installation instructions of ExpressionEngine CMS and the Peer Review Add-on.


Contributing


APEG is open-source, developers are welcome to contribute new features or add new hooks for your LMS or VLE.

APEG can incorporate a Blackboard   rubric  or allow students to supply a numeric 'grade' with comments. The application is optimised for use with the  Blackboard Learn  VLE .  The application can be adapted to to any VLE that implements the IMS Global  Learning Tools Interoperability  (LTI) standard.

docs.text:
About


APEG is a web application developed by Paul Sijpkes.  Paul is a member of the 
BOLD Lab
 at the University of Newcastle, Australia.


Acknowledgements


Thanks for all those who have and are continuing to help and support the development and testing of this tool by trialling it in their courses and for having the vision and patience to try something new, or simply to test the pages over and over again!


University of Newcastle


Robert Zinko, Bonnie McBain, Andrea Cassin, Ramsey Awad, Judith Foggett, Brid Monahan and the staff of the Joint Medical Program and Tim Connor for starting it all.


And, of course, the 
BOLD Lab
 testers:


Andrew Yardy, Nick Barham, Mali Webb, Rebecca Wotzko and Luke Boulton.

docs.text:
Configuration


To configure the tool, access on the LTI link created earlier (ensure you are not in preview mode).


Activate peer assessment


This feature is primarily for developers and will be removed in future releases




Manually Upload the Student Gradebook


To manually upload the student list, first download the 
student list from group export
. Ensure you select the 
Groups and group members
 and 
Include header row
 options. The file will be emailed to you. You will need to download it from the link in the email.




In the instructor view, uploadt the csv file using the form.




Add a Rubric


Export a rubric from Blackboard Learn
 that you would like the students to use to assess each other.




Upload the rubric ZIP file into the peer review tool using the form:



Select the rubric from the dropdown and Attach. You can use Preview to preview the Rubric.


Rubrics will 
not
 attach automatically, ensure you click Attach.




Configure Student View


There are several configuration options for the student view.




Show grade column


students can see the grade others have given them






Show comments


students can see the comments others have given them






Turn on self assessment


students assess their own performance first, they cannot assess others until they have assessed themselves


When changing this setting you will need to resync the user groups (see 
Gradebook Syncronisation
)






Include self in mean score


mean score includes the student's own score, for example if there are 5 in the group and the total score the group has given the student is 300 the final score will be 300/5 = 60 rather than 300/4 = 75






Total maximum score for assessment


used to calculate the percentage score, if you are not using a rubric you can set this here. The rubric total
  score will override this setting if a rubric is attached
docs.title: Administrators

docs.text:
There are several configuration options for the student view.   Show grade column  students can see the grade others have given them    Show comments  students can see the comments others have given them    Turn on self assessment  students assess their own performance first, they cannot assess others until they have assessed themselves  When changing this setting you will need to resync the user groups (see  Gradebook Syncronisation )    Include self in mean score  mean score includes the student's own score, for example if there are 5 in the group and the total score the group has given the student is 300 the final score will be 300/5 = 60 rather than 300/4 = 75    Total maximum score for assessment  used to calculate the percentage score, if you are not using a rubric you can set this here. The rubric total
  score will override this setting if a rubric is attached
docs.title: Configure Student View

docs.text:
Contributing


Contributing to this open source project is easy and you don't have to just contribute to the peer review platform, the EE LTI Module provides a basis to build any type of LTI tool for the ExpressionEngine CMS.  There are three repositories associated with the PRP.


EE LTI Module


This is the core module for ExpressionEngine that allows a secure LTI connection to the VLE.  It is  optimised for Blackboard Learn.


EE LTI Extension Hooks


These are extension hooks providing functionality for the Blackboard Learn environment, including rubric import and gradebook import.  


EE Peer Assessment Plugin


This is the peer assessment plugin, this plugin depends on the above modules.
docs.title: Contributing

docs.text: Contributing to this open source project is easy and you don't have to just contribute to the peer review platform, the EE LTI Module provides a basis to build any type of LTI tool for the ExpressionEngine CMS.  There are three repositories associated with the PRP.

docs.title: EE Peer Assessment Plugin

docs.text:
Installation


Requirements




WebServer with PHP 5 or later


mySQL Database version 5.5 or later


ExpressionEngine Core CMS


EE LTI Module


EE Peer Assessment Plugin


Git version control system




Steps






Download and install a webserver (Apache is recommended), PHP 5, mySQL, git and 
ExpressionEngine Core CMS


There are countless resources on the web to install the above.  The suggested items are all open source or free






Clone and Install the ExpressionEngine Modules
  The most up to date version of the application is available on Bitbucket and comes in two parts,
  the 
EE LTI Module
 and the 
Peer Assessment Plugin


git clone https://sijpkes@bitbucket.org/sijpkes/ee3-lti-module.git







change the name of the folder to learning_tools_integration






copy the entire folder to:


/system/user/addons







Clone the Peer Assessment Plugin


git clone https://sijpkes@bitbucket.org/sijpkes/lti-peer-assessment.git







Repeat steps 3 
 4 for the peer assessment module (you don't need to change the folder name)
docs.title: Installation

docs.text: WebServer with PHP 5 or later  mySQL Database version 5.5 or later  ExpressionEngine Core CMS  EE LTI Module  EE Peer Assessment Plugin  Git version control system
docs.title: Requirements

docs.text:
Download and install a webserver (Apache is recommended), PHP 5, mySQL, git and  ExpressionEngine Core CMS  There are countless resources on the web to install the above.  The suggested items are all open source or free    Clone and Install the ExpressionEngine Modules
  The most up to date version of the application is available on Bitbucket and comes in two parts,
  the  EE LTI Module  and the  Peer Assessment Plugin  git clone https://sijpkes@bitbucket.org/sijpkes/ee3-lti-module.git    change the name of the folder to learning_tools_integration    copy the entire folder to:  /system/user/addons    Clone the Peer Assessment Plugin  git clone https://sijpkes@bitbucket.org/sijpkes/lti-peer-assessment.git    Repeat steps 3   4 for the peer assessment module (you don't need to change the folder name)
docs.title: Steps

docs.text:
Instructors


Adding the LTI Link


Once the templates have been setup by the 
Administrator
 you will be supplied with the details for the LTI link as it appears in 
Blackboard Learn


LTI Link Settings


Once the link has been placed in your course, you can manage settings as an Instructor by clicking the link.  To preview the tool, it is first necessary to 
keep your preview user
 and subsequently

add your preview user to a group
.  Once in student preview, you will then see the group as a 
student
.


Blackboard Learn




LTI link URL


Key


Secret


Customised Parameters






Adding a Description (Single Line Only)


Note that there is a bug in blackboard that does not properly encode multi-line descriptions, so keep your description short and on a single line.




Previewing as a Student


You can see the student view by adding your Blackboard preview user to a group and then syncronising the PRP with Blackboard.


View a general guide at blackboard.com on how to add users to groups
.




Ensure you Save your preview user by accessing the 
  and then clicking the 
 button.


Exit preview mode.


Access Users and Groups -
 Groups.




Select Edit Group in the drop down:
      






Click 
Add Users
 and search for 
Username -
 Contains -
 [your username]
.






Your username will be:
          
[your username] underscore preview user
,


so the username 
jb123
 would have a preview user 
jb123_previewuser










Depending on your setup you may need to 
Manually Upload the Student Gradebook
. The APEG will do this for you if correctly configured. If so, skip this step and continue to Step 7 otherwise speak to your 
Administrator
.






You can now use preview mode to access the LTI link created earlier and view the peer review group you added your previewuser to in step 4 to 6 earlier.

You can see the student view by adding your Blackboard preview user to a group and then syncronising the PRP with Blackboard.  View a general guide at blackboard.com on how to add users to groups .   Ensure you Save your preview user by accessing the    and then clicking the   button.  Exit preview mode.  Access Users and Groups -  Groups.   Select Edit Group in the drop down:
          Click  Add Users  and search for  Username -  Contains -  [your username] .    Your username will be:
           [your username] underscore preview user ,  so the username  jb123  would have a preview user  jb123_previewuser      Depending on your setup you may need to  Manually Upload the Student Gradebook . The APEG will do this for you if correctly configured. If so, skip this step and continue to Step 7 otherwise speak to your  Administrator .    You can now use preview mode to access the LTI link created earlier and view the peer review group you added your previewuser to in step 4 to 6 earlier.
docs.title: Previewing as a Student

docs.text:
Students


The instructor may elect to use a rubric or not, without a rubric the student view will look like 
the top image
.  With the rubric a button will appear as in the 
second image
.  Use the button to assess the other students.


If your instructor has self assessment turned on, the first person in the list will be yourself (
bottom image
).  You will not be able to evaluate other students until you have evaluated yourself.


Save vs. Submit






The 
Save
 button will allow you to save your submission and return to it later.






The 
Submit
 button will submit the assessment and will not allow you to return to it.  However, if your instructor has rolling review turned on you will be able to continue submitting multiple reviews.






No rubric


Note that the wording and appearance of screenshots may vary depending on the course you are in


Step by Step Guide




Select the link in your course


Enter a numeric grade in the text box next to each student's name


Write a comment if required, otherwise add a hyphen '
' for the student in the comment box


Repeat steps 1 to 6 for each person in your group


Select Save if you want to come back later to change your evaluation


Select Submit if you are ready to submit the assessment.

  
WARNING - you will not be able to undo step 6, so be sure of the evaluations you have provided.






With Rubric


Note that the wording and appearance of screenshots may vary depending on the course you are in


Step by Step Guide




Select the link in your course


Select the 'Grade' 
or
 'Evaluate' button


Select the radio button for each criterion
      


Click 
Save 
 Close


The student's score will appear next to their name


Write a comment if required, otherwise add a hyphen '
' for the student in the comment box


Repeat steps 1 to 6 for each person in your group


Select Save if you want to come back later to change your evaluation


Select Submit if you are ready to submit the assessment.

  
WARNING - you will not be able to undo step 9, so be sure of the evaluations you have provided.






With Rubric and Self-Assess


Note that the wording and appearance of screenshots may vary depending on the course you are in


Step by Step Guide




Select the link in your course


Select the 'Grade' 
or
 'Evaluate' button next to your name


Select the radio button for each criterion to 
honestly
 evaluate your own performance

  
You will not be able to evaluate the other people in your group until you have evaluated yourself

  Now for each of the people in your group:


Select the 'Grade' 
or
 'Evaluate' button


Select the radio button for each criterion
      


Click 
Save 
 Close


The student's score will appear next to their name


Write a comment if required, otherwise add a hyphen '
' for the student in the comment box


Repeat steps 4 to 6 for each person in your group


Select Save if you want to come back later to change your evaluation


Select Submit if you are ready to submit the assessment.

  
WARNING - you will not be able to undo step 9, so be sure of the evaluations you have provided.
docs.title: Students

docs.text: The instructor may elect to use a rubric or not, without a rubric the student view will look like  the top image .  With the rubric a button will appear as in the  second image .  Use the button to assess the other students.  If your instructor has self assessment turned on, the first person in the list will be yourself ( bottom image ).  You will not be able to evaluate other students until you have evaluated yourself.

docs.text:
Example templates


These templates are provided as usable examples. Further examples can be 
downloaded as a ZIP file
.  


For details on how to setup to setup templates in ExpressionEngine check the 
Template Language Overview
.


Blackboard Learn Templates


Landing Page Example


Landing Page


Landing page for students and instructors, renders default views as described in the 
Instructors
 and 
Student
 guides


Marking Guide


Marking Guide


Marking guide for students, this is can be optionally linked from the index page.


Rubric


Rubric


Template for rendering Blackboard Learn rubrics.
docs.title: Home

Landing Page Example Template


!DOCTYPE html



html


head

    
title
{resource_title}
/title

    
meta content=
width=device-width, initial-scale=1
 name=
viewport

    
script src=
https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/2.2.3/jquery.min.js

    
/script

    
link href=
https://maxcdn.bootstrapcdn.com/bootstrap/3.3.7/css/bootstrap.min.css
 rel=
stylesheet

    
link href=
{theme_folder_url}learning_tools_integration/css/bootstrap-select.min.css
 rel=
stylesheet


    
script src=
https://maxcdn.bootstrapcdn.com/bootstrap/3.3.7/js/bootstrap.min.js

    
/script

    
script src=
{theme_folder_url}learning_tools_integration/js/bootstrap-select.min.js

    
/script

    
script src=
{theme_folder_url}learning_tools_integration/js/bootbox.min.js
/script


/head



body


style

                body {
                    font-family: 'verdana',Arial,Helvetica,sans-serif;
                }
                             .peer_comments {
                                        font-size: 14pt;
                                        padding: 0.8em;
                             }
                 h1, h2, h3, .baklink {
                    text-align: center;
                 }
                             .peer_comments 
 p{
                                        font-family: 
Courier New
, courier, mono-space;
                    text-align: center;
                             }
                             .peer_grades {

                             }
                             .score_spacer {
                                        width: 55px;
                                        min-width: 55px;
                                        display: inline-block;
                             }
                             .help_link {
                                        padding-top: 1.4em;
                             }


/style


div class='container-fluid'

    
div class='row'

            {if lti_has_error}
            
div class='col-xs-12 col-sm-12 well col-xs-offset-0 col-sm-offset-0 col-lg-offset-0'

                        {if lti_has_error == 
session expired
}
                                
p
Your session has expired, please return to the course and click the link again.
/p

                        {if:else}
                                
p
{lti_has_error}
/p

                        {/if}
            
/div

            {/if}

    {exp:learning_tools_integration prev_link_url='//localhost:9876/images/ci/ng/small_previous.gif' next_link_url='//uonline.newcastle.edu.au/images/ci/ng/small_next.gif' first_link_url='//uonline.newcastle.edu.au/images/ci/ng/small_rewind.gif' last_link_url='//uonline.newcastle.edu.au/images/ci/ng/small_ffwd.gif' plugins='lti_peer_assessment'} 
!-- {css_link_tags} --
 
!-- imported from LMS --

    {if error_messages != 
} {error_messages} {/if} {if logged_in_username}

            
div class='col-xs-12 col-sm-12 well col-xs-offset-0 col-sm-offset-0 col-lg-offset-0'

                
h1
{resource_title}
/h1



                
p
{resource_link_description}
/p



                
p
span class='warningMsg'{general_message}
/span

                
/p



                
p class='baklink'
a href='{launch_presentation_return_url}'
Return to course: {course_name}
/a

                
/p

            
/div

        
/div

        {if is_instructor == 1}

        
div class='row'

        {if group_id == 1}
            
div class='col-xs-12 col-sm-3 col-md-3 col-xs-offset-0 col-sm-offset-1 col-md-offset-1 well'

                
h2
General Settings
/h2



                
div id='admin'

                    
h3
Group import 
amp; Plugin settings
/h3

                    {general_settings_form}
                
/div


            
/div

        {/if}

            
div class='col-xs-12 col-sm-8 col-md-6 col-xs-offset-0 col-sm-offset-1 col-md-offset-1 well'

                
h1
Students registered for Peer Evaluation
/h1

                
!--style='display: inline-block'--

                {student_table}
            
/div

        
/div



        
div class='row'

            
div class='col-xs-12 col-sm-4 col-xs-offset-0 col-sm-offset-1 well'

                
h3
Download Evaluations
/h3



                
h4
em
Download Evaluations as Excel Spreadsheet
/em
/h4

        
p
This spreadsheet contains a detailed breakdown of each peer assessment
          and how marks for each rubric criteria (if specified) were distributed.
/p

                {exp:lti_peer_assessment:download_excel}

        
h4
em
Download Evaluations as a simple CSV
/em
/h4

        
p
This is a basic option formatted in rows in a CSV.
/p

                {exp:lti_peer_assessment:download_csv}
            
/div



            
div class='col-xs-12 col-sm-4 col-md-4 col-xs-offset-0 col-sm-offset-1 col-md-offset-1 well'

                
h3
Give Students Access to Peer Evaluation {exp:lti_peer_assessment:help_link section='instructors' sub_section='manual_gradebook_upload' class='contextual_help_inline'}
/h3

                {upload_student_list}
            
/div

        
/div

    
/div



    
div class='row'

        
div class='col-xs-12 col-sm-4 col-xs-offset-0 col-sm-offset-1 well'

            
h3
Configure the Student View {exp:lti_peer_assessment:help_link section='instructors' sub_section='student_view' class='contextual_help_inline'}
/h3

            {exp:lti_peer_assessment:settings radio_labels='Yes: ,No: '} {form_open} {if group_id == '1'}

            
div class='well'

                
h4
Admin Permissions
/h4



                
p
Instructors that can view Settings and Download assessment results
br

                {instructors_dropdown}
/p

            
/div

            {/if}

            
div class='well'

                
p
Score calculation algorithm: {score_calculation_dropdown}
/p



                
p
br

                
a href='//sparkplus.com.au/factors/#spa-sapa-header' target='_blank'
Further information on SPARK SPA and SAPA algorithms (Willey, K)
/a

                
/p

            
/div



            
div class='well'

                
p
Students can view others' grades.
br

                {show_grade_column} 
label for='show_grade_column'
{label} {radio}
/label
 {/show_grade_column}
/p



                
p
Students can view others' comments.
br

                {show_comments} 
label for='show_comments'
{label} {radio}
/label
 {/show_comments}
/p



                
p
Students can see SAPA comparison.
br

                {show_sapa} 
label for='show_sapa'
{label} {radio}
/label
 {/show_sapa}
/p

            
/div



            
div class='well'

                
p
Students assess themselves as well as the group (self assessment).
br

                
em
This option sets the first user in the list to the logged in student, all other students are greyed out until the student has self assessed
/em
br

                {allow_self_assessment} 
label for='show_sapa'
{label} {radio}
/label
 {/allow_self_assessment}
/p

            
/div



            
div class='well'

                
p
Self score is included in the mean calculation for the group.
br

                
em
This option includes the student's self assessment score in the mean calculation from the group score.
/em
br

                {include_self_in_mean_score} 
label for='include_self_in_mean_score'
{label} {radio}
